_header: My very joy and most perfect pleasure
Subjects: roundels; love lyrics; lovers, addresses to beloved
_description:
A roundel, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 33) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines: MI verry ioy and most parfit plesereWhiche are of me and all y haue maystres…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …So willith me se yow so dowtlesThat half how moche y kan not say yow here
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
